newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT-Lojas Americanas still hold.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Lojas Americanas still hold.

text.p: -- Banco Patrimonio, a local associate of Salomon Brothers, said it is maintaining its hold recommendation on Brazilian retailer Lojas Americanas, but has reduced its 1996 earnings estimate for the firm.
-- The bank said Lojas Americanas' second-quarter loss of $6.4 million was worse than expected "as we had projected a small profit or, at least, break even."
-- It said the loss was largely due to a $17.9 million bad debt provision in the second quarter while the firm's material gross margin improved in the period.

-- Patrimonio, which downgraded the firm's shares last month to hold from buy, said it has further reduced its 1996 net earnings estimate for Lojas Americanas to $33 million from $39 million and lowered its earnings per share estimate to $0.72 from $0.85.
-- But the bank added that it had not expected the improvement in the retailer's gross margin this soon.
-- Lojas Americanas shares have dropped 32 percent year-to-date in contrast with the Sao Paulo stock exchange's 38.2 percent rally, the bank said.
-- Lojas Americanas' preferred was flat at 17.05 reais at 1613 local time/1913 GMT on the Sao Paulo bourse.
-- Lojas Americanas has a 40 percent stake in WalMart Brazil.
